paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data from individual cases.

patients.phenotype: QT prolongation and TdP during fever

individual_records.phenotype_details: Marked QT prolongation (QTc = 563 ms) and TdP during moderate grade fever (38.5°C).
individual_records.evidence_sentence: At age 47, she experienced marked QT prolongation (QTc = 563 ms) and TdP during an outpatient visit for moderate grade fever (38.5°C) due to pyelonephritis.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Marked QT prolongation (QTc = 566 ms) and TdP during moderate grade fever (39°C).
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Electrocardiography performed in the emergency room revealed marked QT prolongation (QTc = 566 ms) and TdP (Figure 1D).

functional_data.summary: G584S mutation leads to reduced temperature-dependent increases in tail current densities and enhanced inactivation.

variants.additional_notes: All patients with KCNH2 G584S were heterozygous.
key_quotes: We identified a KCNH2 G584S mutation from Case 1.
We also identified a KCNH2 D609G mutation and a KCNQ1 D611Y mutation from Case 2.

patients.phenotype: QT prolongation and TdP during fever

individual_records.phenotype_details: Marked QT prolongation (QTc = 566 ms) and TdP during moderate grade fever (39°C).
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Electrocardiography performed in the emergency room revealed marked QT prolongation (QTc = 566 ms) and TdP (Figure 1D).

functional_data.summary: D609G mutation leads to no functional channel currents when expressed alone.

variants.additional_notes: D609G was identified in a patient with QT prolongation and TdP.
key_quotes: We also identified a KCNH2 D609G mutation and a KCNQ1 D611Y mutation from Case 2.

patients.phenotype: QT prolongation and TdP during fever

individual_records.phenotype_details: QT prolongation (QTc = 695 ms) and TdP during low-grade fever (38°C or higher).
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient with KCNH2 T613M was a 25-year-old female diagnosed with LQTS at age 8.

functional_data.summary: T613M mutation leads to reduced temperature-dependent increases in tail current densities.

variants.additional_notes: T613M was identified in a patient with QT prolongation and TdP.
key_quotes: At age 25, she experienced an episode of QT prolongation (QTc = 695 ms) and TdP during low-grade fever (38°C or higher).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
